The claim made by Michael Needham: CEO of Heritage Action, that the federal budget bill reauthorizes the Overseas Private Investment Corporation (OPIC) to provide taxpayer dollars for the Four Seasons hotel to build a resort in Turkey.
The clarification that Needham misspoke: Carlton hotel, not the Four Seasons.
The explanation of OPIC as a government: run finance institution that provides loans with interest and political risk insurance, specifically aimed at helping American businesses enter developing economies.
The confirmation that OPIC did provide a: 50 million loan to the Ritz-Carlton Hotel Company in 2000 for the purpose of opening a hotel in Turkey.
